items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.

items.item_details:
Education Code 81655 stipulates that no contract is an enforceable obligation of the District until it has been approved by the Board of Trustees.  Board Policy 6100 establishes the authority of certain administrators to approve contracts under the bid limit prior to formal Board approval.  All contracts and purchase orders exceeding the current bid limit of $83,400 shall have prior Board approval as a separate board item.
	 
This consent item presents for Board approval: all purchase orders for this period, which includes purchase orders for administratively approved contracts exceeding $1,000, as well as additional contracts that, although are not executed by way of purchase order, are deemed appropriate to be added by the Purchasing Department.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees ratify the contracts and purchase orders for the period of April 10, 2013 through May 9, 2013 as noted in the attached documents.

items.item_details:
The Master Agreement between the San Jose Evergreen Community College District and the SJECCD Foundation has had several revisions and/or material changes submitted to the Board of Trustees for approvals:
	 
An original Master Agreement was entered into between the San Jose Evergreen Community College District and the SJECCD Foundation with a June 15, 1982 through June 30, 1987 term.  Seven additional Amendments to this Master Agreement extended the Agreement through June 30, 1998 (Attachment A).
The contract was subsequently extended through June 30, 1999 (Attachment B).
A Master Agreement with updated language was BOT approved on July 28, 1998 with an effective term of July 1, 1999 through June 30, 2004, which included Addendum #1 and Addendum #2, both undated (Attachment C).  
A Master Agreement with updated language was entered into between the San Jose Evergreen Community College District and the SJECCD Foundation on July 1, 2006, which included “Addendum #1 and Addendum #2”  and had a term of July 1, 2006 through June 30, 2008 (Attachment D). The document submitted made material changes to the Agreement, which required that the Agreement be sent to the State Chancellor’s office for review. However, the review was never requested. As a result, the District and the Foundation continued to operate under the 2006-2008 Master Agreement by mutual assumption that each continued to honor the terms of the expired agreement.  
Under advisement of the Foundation’s legal counsel, on June 14, 2011, the 2006-2008 Master Agreement was formally extended to June 30, 2013 as reflected in Amendment 9 (Attachment E).
	 
Being submitted for Board approval is Amendment No. 10, which extends the Master Agreement through June 30, 2014 (Attachment F).
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve an extension through June 30, 2014 to the Master Agreement with the San Jose /Evergreen Community College District Foundation.
items.item_text: San Jose/Evergreen Community College District Foundation Master Agreement Extension
items.item_text_raw: 9. San Jose/Evergreen Community College District Foundation Master Agreement Extension

items.item_details:
The purpose of the Tentative Budget is to obtain the Board's approval of an interim budget for the new fiscal year that will authorize the District to expend funds beginning July 1, 2013 while the Legislature deliberates and adopts a final state budget for the fiscal year. In September the Adopted Budget will be presented for board approval reflecting final legislative actions.
	 
The Tentative Budget is provided as an attachment to this item and also can be accessed on the District's web site.

items.item_details:
Government Code Section 7908(c) requires each community college district to report its appropriation limit to the State Chancellor of Community Colleges at least annually.
	 
The appropriation limit must be approved by the Board of Trustees in accordance with Government Code Section 7910.
	 
After the Board of Trustees approves the appropriation limit, the GANN will be reported on the Annual Financial and Budget Report (CCFS-311) to the State Chancellor of Community Colleges, which is due on October 10, 2013.

On June 26, 2012, the Board of Trustees awarded a contract to CampusWorks for strategic technology infrastructure services for a period of three years, subject to determination of satisfactory performance annually by the Board of Trustees commencing July 1, 2012.  
	 
On March 12, 2013, Liz Murphy, CEO of CampusWorks, provided a presentation to the Board of Trustees outlining the work that has been accomplished in the first six months of the contract and identified areas of focus for the next six months.
	 
Liz Murphy will provide a presentation updating the Board of Trustees pursuant to the request in June 2012 for an annual report detailing the performance of CampusWorks and compliance with the covenants within the contract.

items.item_details:
The District Office, San Jose City College, Evergreen Valley College, and Workforce Institute are all currently running on different web platforms that are not integrated and do not meet the needs of our constituents and does not align with the District Communications Plan.  The District issued an RFP to determine available options to put web resources on the same platform but allowing for the unique requirements of each of the four entities.  The following background details the process that was undertaken to recommend a vendor.
	 
Background:
On January 30, 2013, Bid Proposal 13-0221 for the Website Redesign Project for SJECCCD was announced.
Four proposals were received.
The Evaluation Committee was comprised of 3 Administrators from the District Office, 1 Administrator from Workforce Institute, 1 Administrator from Evergreen Valley College, and 1 Classified Member from the District Office.
The Evaluation Committee invited the four respondents to give a presentation on March 22, 2013.
Two respondents were asked to give another presentation on April 19, 2013, to end-users to determine their ability to interface with the end-users, to present their ideas for the website, to give a live demo, and to answer questions.
Based on these presentations and the overall performance the End-user/Evaluation Team/Information Systems Steering Group recommends Kiefer Consulting for website redesign and implementation in the amount not to exceed $277,800.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Tustees award a contract not to exceed $277,800 to Kiefer Consulting for website redesign and implementation.
items.item_text: Website Redesign RFP Award
items.item_text_raw: 5. Website Redesign RFP Award

items.item_details:
The film Photography department at San Jose City College is currently located in the 100 Wing building in several rooms that were last renovated in the mid 1970’s.  These facilities are outdated, inadequate, and in serious disrepair.  This space is also planned to be re-purposed and updated as part of the planned Vocational Technology Buildings renovation, scheduled to begin in December, 2013.  Therefore, San Jose City College requested that 2 existing classrooms within the Technology Center be improved to house the film Photography department in modern updated facilities, in close proximity to the digital photography and journalism programs already located in the Technology Center.
	 
In November 2012, the Board approved a Project Assignment Amendment with Artik Art & Architecture to provide design and construction phase administration services for the project.  Since November 2012, Artik has met regularly with the Design Committee made up of SJCC Faculty members to establish the College’s needs, and refine the project design.  The Design Committee is pleased with the outcome of the design, and is looking forward to the planned move.
	 
A public bidding process for contractors was conducted between May 6, 2013 and May 23, 2013.  The project was advertised in local papers on May 7th, May 14th and published at 15 local builders exchanges and plan rooms.  In addition, invitations to bid were sent to over 75 contractors.  A mandatory pre-bid meeting was held on May 16, 2013 with approximately 26 interested contractors and subcontractors.  Bids were opened at 4pm on May 23, 2013.  Based on the evaluation of bid prices and required documentation, it was determined that Premier Builders, Inc. was the apparent lowest responsible bidder.
	 
On June 3, 2013, the District received a bid protest from the number 2 bidder, R.C. Benson based on several items they felt were not appropriately addressed in Premier’s Bid Proposal.  The protest was received 5 days after the deadline set forth in the Instructions to Bidders, and was therefore an invalid protest.  Premier Builders did respond and satisfactorily address the three issues raised by RC Benson including listing of flooring subcontractor, fire alarm & data subcontractors, and inclusion of the Small & Disadvantaged Contractors/Suppliers Form. District Counsel reviewed the protest and response by Premier Builders addressing the three issues. District Counsel and the Purchasing Department are in agreement that Premier Builders is the lowest qualified bidder, and should be awarded the contract, while the protest submitted by R.C. Benson should be dismissed as invalid due to late submission.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve issuance of a contract to Premier Builders, Inc. in the amount of $430,705 for the San Jose City College Photo Lab Relocation Project.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: SJCC Photo Lab Relocation Project
items.item_text_raw: 6. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: SJCC Photo Lab Relocation Project

items.item_details:
On November 27, 2012 the Board awarded a contract in the amount of $1,108,300 to BHM Construction, Inc. (BHM) for construction of the Measure G-2010 project â EVC Interim Police Facility & G-2010 Offices.  On March 12, 2013 the Board approved Change Order #001 in the amount of $15,490.
	 
Construction contracts often experience unforeseen conditions, coordination gaps and/or design changes that require an adjustment to the contract price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  BHM Construction submitted written pricing proposals for changes detailed in an attachment that include additional or deleted materials, equipment, labor, time extensions as applicable and the prescribed mark-ups.  The Architect, Program Manager and Inspector of Record subsequently reviewed the proposals to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms and recommend the approval of Change Order #002 in the amount of $26,548.  (Detail of the changes is in the item attachment.)
	 
                        Original Contract Amount                            $1,108,300
                        Previous Approved Changes                            $15,490
                        Change Order #002                                          $26,548
                        Total Contract and Changes                        $1,150,338
	 
Total contract change orders amount to approximately 3.8% of the original contract.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order #002 to BHM Construction, Inc. in the amount of $26,548 for the Evergreen Valley College Interim Police Facility & G-2010 Offices, and to extend the time for Final Completion to April 30, 2013.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: EVC-Interim Police Facility & G-2010 Offices, BHM Construction Change Order #002
items.item_text_raw: 7. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: EVC-Interim Police Facility & G-2010 Offices, BHM Construction Change Order #002

items.item_details:
In July, 2012 the District received an update to the San Jose/Evergreen Community College District Security Master Plan that included recommendation for various projects to address security concerns identified by the Plan.  The Measure G-2010 project list includes funding for Physical Security projects at both colleges.  
	 
The District issued Request for Qualifications (RFQ) for Physical Security Services consultants to develop bid documents for projects in keeping with the updated Security Master Plan on a work-order basis through Measure G-2010.  Outreach efforts included posting to the District Purchasing website and direct contact by e-mail and phone to several security firms.
	 
On April 11, 2013, the District received a Statement of Qualifications (SOQ) from eleven (11) firms in response to the RFQ.  A District Review Panel consisting of representatives from the District, Police and each college reviewed each SOQ and ranked the firms.  From those rankings, a Review Panel of District and College personnel shortlisted four (4) firms to be interviewed.  Based on the results of the interviews the panel has recommended two firms be selected as a pool for implementation of the Physical Security Master Plan process (in alphabetical order):
	 
Catalyst Consulting Group, Incorporated
Guidepost Solutions
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Catalyst Consulting Group, Incorporated and Guidepost Solutions as the consultant pool to implement the updated Security Master Plan.
items.item_text: Master Consulting Agreements for Security Master Plan Projects
items.item_text_raw: 8. Master Consulting Agreements for Security Master Plan Projects

items.item_details:
On April 12, 2011 the Board approved a contract with Impact Sciences, Inc. to prepare Environmental Impact Reports (EIR) and associated mitigation monitoring program services for the 2025 Facilities Master Plans (FMP) for Evergreen Valley College and San Jose City College to support the successful implementation of the various construction and deferred maintenance projects identified in the FMPs.
	 
During the development of the EIRs, the FMPs for both colleges were updated.  Impact Sciences used those updated FMPs to develop draft EIRs.  In accordance with California law, these draft EIRs were presented to the public by notices and public hearings.  Comments received during the comment period were incorporated into the Final EIR for each college.  In accordance with California law, a “Findings of Fact and a Statement of Overriding Considerations” has been prepared for each plan.   The Final EIRs and the Findings of Facts for each plan are now presented to the Board for certification and approval by the District.
	 
Additionally, CEQA requires that a lead agency (in this case SJECCD) file a Notice of Determination within five working days after deciding to carry out or approve a project. In order to file the notice for each EIR, each campus is required to pay Department of Fish and Game fees and a County Administrative fee which total $3,045.25 per campus. As such the Board is asked to approve an expenditure totaling $6,090.50 for these fees.
	 
Attachments:
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Final Environmental Impact Reports and “Findings of Fact and a Statement of Overriding Considerations” for both the Evergreen Valley College 2025 Facilities Master Plan and the San Jose City College 2025 Facilities Master Plan, and that the Board approve payments of $6,090.50 for Department of Fish and Game and County Administrative fees.
items.item_text: EVC and SJCC 2025 Facility Master Plans – Environmental Impact Reports
items.item_text_raw: 9. EVC and SJCC 2025 Facility Master Plans – Environmental Impact Reports

items.item_details:
As part of the accountability measures for the Measure G-2010 Bond Program, the management team for the program has put into place a formal process for managing, tracking and presenting to the Board of Trustees all revisions to the Measure G-2010 individual project names, scopes and budgets.  This process adheres to the accountability standards outlined by Proposition 39 and provides transparency in the evolution of the project list.
	 
These revisions are the result of careful coordination and realignment with the current Facilities Master Plans and the planned implementation of the projects at each campus.
	 
Measure G-2010 Bond List Revision #4 includes the following actions:
Project 39310 - ITSS/MDF Relocation and Consolidation:  A portion of the scope and budget of this project is being transferred to project 39301. 
This project is also being re-named “MDF Relocation”
	 
Project 39301 - Property Acquisition/Relocation or Renovation of District Offices/WI:  Scope and budget from projects 39310 and 39620 are being consolidated with this project. 
This project is also being re-named “New District Office Building”
	 
Project 39620 – Group II Equipment – Includes safety & security:   Budget and scope consolidated with project 39301.
	 
Project 31107 – Theatre & Vocational Technology:
This project is being re-named “Media Arts Center & Career Technical Education”
	 
Interest Earnings Allocations - allocations to projects 31199, 32299 & 39399
	 
These Bond List Revisions have been approved by the Evergreen Valley College and San Jose City College Vice Presidents of Administrative Services and the Vice Chancellor of Administrative Services.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees review and approve the revisions to the Measure G - 2010 bond list, as presented.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond List Revision #4
items.item_text_raw: 10. Measure G-2010 Bond List Revision #4

items.item_details:
The previous Measure G 2004 Bond List Revision was approved by the Board of Trustees in on December 11, 2012. Revisions are presented to the Board on a quarterly basis or periodically as needed. 
	 
A bond list revision is requested for adjustments to multiple projects within the G-2004 Bond Program. 
	 
	 
The Measure G-2004 Bond List Revision dated June 11, 2013 includes the following actions:
	 
San Jose City College - Savings in the amount of $12, 879 from projects 114 and 125 are being transferred to project 122: Physical Education Gymnasium.
	 
Evergreen Valley College - Savings in the amount of $310 from project 219 are being transferred to project 210: Modernization of Existing Facilities.
	 
District Project 309 - Has been re-named âJoint Use 21st Century Post-Secondary Education Centerâ.  Additionally, savings from project 305 have been transferred to this project. 
	 
FY 12-13 Q2 & Q3 Interest Earnings - Allocated to Project 399: Program Contingency
	 
These Bond List Revisions have been approved by the Evergreen Valley College and San Jose City College Vice Presidents of Administrative Services and the Vice Chancellor of Administrative Services.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees review and approve the revisions to the Measure G - 2004 bond list, as presented.
items.item_text: Measure G-2004 Bond List Revision
items.item_text_raw: 11. Measure G-2004 Bond List Revision

items.item_details:
The District successfully passed Measure G-2010 on November 2, 2010.  On January 25, 2011 a facilities and bonds study session served as an opportunity to share a framework for success for Measure G-2010.  Included in this framework was the recommendation that the District utilize a program and construction management firm to provide program and construction management services to the colleges and District to support implementation of various construction and deferred maintenance projects.  In keeping with the District’s desire to promote accountability, efficiency and cost effectiveness, the District went through a formal Request for Qualifications process to seek the services of a Program and Construction Management firm to provide system-wide coordination and oversight of all capital improvement work performed under the Measure G-2010 bond program.  Gilbane Building Company was selected through this process. 
	 
Since the initial one-year contract with Gilbane awarded by the Board on May 10, 2011, policies and procedures for operating under the Bond have been implemented, overall program and detailed project scheduling has been established and maintained, accounting and purchasing procedures have been put in place and numerous projects have commenced design and are going into construction at the campuses and the District. 
	 
On June 12, 2012 the Board approved the second year (FY2012/2013) contract renewal with Gilbane in the amount of $4,646,050.  Actual costs for (FY2013/2013) are coming in well under the approved contract.
	 
Overall the Program Management budget for the life of the bond program has been established at 3% of the construction budget.  Approval of the third year agreement stays within this 3% allocation (see attached Program Management graph).  Overall the Construction Management budget for the life of the bond program has been established at 9% of the construction budget.  Approval of the third year agreement stays within this 9% allocation (see attached Construction Management graph).  Note that as was the case for the first year of the agreement, Gilbane’s services for year two will come in under the original budget by approximately $700,000 (see attached detailed breakdown).
	 
Note too that the basic services and contract terms and conditions remain unchanged.
	 
Attachments:
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the third year renewal of Gilbane’s PM/CM contract for fiscal year 2013/2014 for the not-to-exceed amount of $5,627,569.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 PM/CM Contract Renewal for Fiscal 2013/2014
items.item_text_raw: 12. Measure G-2010 PM/CM Contract Renewal for Fiscal 2013/2014

items.item_details:
In November 2004 the voters approved Measure G in the amount of $185 million.  One of the projects included in that bond measure was the establishment of a Joint-use Education Center in partnership with the Milpitas Unified School District. Subsequently, the Board of Trustees authorized up to $10 million for the project.
	 
On October 9, 2012 the District entered into a Memorandum of Understanding setting forth the intent to develop a joint use 21st century education center to be constructed on MUSD property, financed by SJECCD bond funds and operated jointly by the Parties.  This MOU outlined the major elements and terms of agreement.
	 
On February 26, 2013 at a joint meeting with MUSD, the District Board of Trustees heard a report on the Joint-use Education Center and took action to accept the “Status Report” prepared collaboratively by Chancellor Cepeda and Superintendent Matsuoka.  This report provided an agreed upon framework for production of a formal “land lease agreement”, including the guiding mission and vision of both boards, the collaborative principles and guidelines to be used by staff in the effectuation of that vision and the key components necessary for the development of the terms for a land lease agreement.  
	 
On April 9, 2013 the Board of Trustees received an update and reviewed the terms of the land lease agreement.
	 
On May 28, 2013 the Board of Trustees reviewed the terms represented in this contract during Closed Session.
  
It is the recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Ground Lease and Joint Use Agreement by and between Milpitas Unified School District and San Jose Evergreen Community College District for the Joint Use 21st Century Education Center, Milpitas, California.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Ground Lease and Joint Use Agreement by and between Milpitas Unified School District and San Jose Evergreen Community College District for the Joint Use 21st Century Education Center, Milpitas, California.

items.item_details: At the May 28, 2013, meeting, the Board of Trustees approved a revised schedule which removed the July 9, 2013, meeting from the board meeting schedule.  However, in order to ensure compliance with Ed Code, Section 72000, it is recommended the Board rescind that action and restore the July 9, 2013, meeting to the FY2013-2014 Schedule of Governing Board Meeting Dates and Corresponding Deadlines.

items.item_details: In order to aid in the efficient execution of various personnel matters by the Human Resources Department, the Board finds it necessary to delegate its statutory powers over certain personnel actions to the Chancellor, Vice Chancellor of Human Resources and/or designee.  It is, therefore, recommended that the Board of Trustees approve Resolution No. 61113-3 for the Delegation of Authority to the Chancellor or her designee for fiscal year 2013-2014 for resignations and hires.

This report represents the status of schedule and cost for Measure G-2010 projects from inception through May 31, 2013, with financial data reconciled through March 31, 2013.

items.item_details:
As has been discussed with the Board previously, the Acacia and Roble Complexes are located within a seismic fault zone that has been determined to be active.  As required by law, the District notified the State Chancellor's Office of this issue in October 2011 and has been actively engaged in the planning activities that will result in the removal and replacement of these buildings out of the fault zone.  
	 
The space provided by the Acacia and Roble Complexes will be repositioned under three projects currently represented on the Measure G-2010 Bond Project List: South Campus Development, Automotive Technology and Engineering & Applied Technology. The District does, however, have the opportunity and requirement to apply to the State for funding support for a component of this program due to the seismic issue.  As such, an Initial Project Proposal (IPP) for Acacia - Roble Replacement (Engineering & Applied Technology) for the 2015-16 funding year was submitted to the State Chancellor's Office in July of 2012.  The IPP was approved by the Chancellor’s Office thus allowing the District to proceed with a Final Project Proposal. The draft project proposal requests the State to support 50% of the budget for the demolition of Roble and Acacia and replacement of space represented by the project referred to as Engineering & Applied Technology on the Measure G-2010 Master Bond Project List.
	 
Reference: Evergreen Valley College Seismic Information presentation to the Board, November 29, 2011 as Information Item I.4
http://www.boarddocs.com/ca/sjeccd/Board.nsf/goto?open&id=8NUSJP6C1B6C
Reference:  Initial Project Proposal, approved by the Board August 14, 2012 as Action Item H.3
http://www.boarddocs.com/ca/sjeccd/Board.nsf/goto?open&id=8WWRMZ6EA2DE

items.item_details:
The District is required to submit, on an annual basis, a Five Year Capital Construction Plan to the State Chancellor's Office that summarizes current and proposed capital outlay projects.  This plan includes all state and locally funded capital construction projects the District will be working on within the next five years.  This plan is required to be adopted by the Board of Trustees.
	 
The Plan is submitted here in draft at the State Chancellor Office’s direction.  The Five Year Capital Construction Plan cannot be considered “final” until the Final Project Proposal for the Engineering & Applied Technology building at Evergreen Valley College is submitted to their office as final.  This will be done in early August 2013.
items.item_text: 2015 - 2019 Five Year Construction Plan

items.item_details:
Pursuant to Government Code Section 3547, the San Jose/Evergreen Community College District presents their Reopener Proposal with the Faculty Association, AFT 6157 for 2013-2014.  The District requests that issues in the following articles be negotiated for 2013-2014.
	 
	 
Article 31.6.2 - Reopeners provided by the current contract
	 
Articles 8, 9, 17, and 18 
	 
Two additional Articles 
	 
	 
Article 12
Professional Responsibilities
             Increase specificity for time and/or day commitment to professional responsibilities
	 
Load
             Split load
             Online Instruction Load Limit
	 
Article 15
Load limit in intersession and summer
Compensation paid during intersession and summer  
	 
	 
The District reserves the right to add, amend, delete and/or change any of these proposals.
	 
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
Present the District's contract reopener proposal for 2013-2014, and announcement of a public hearing to be conducted at the July 9, 2013 Board meeting.
